Once upon a time in a vibrant forest, there lived a clever fox named Felix. Unlike other foxes, Felix had no tail, which made him feel different and out of place. One day, he overheard a group of animals gossiping about a grand feast in the meadow. Determined to join, he devised a plan. Felix painted a colorful tail with berries and leaves, fooling everyone at the feast. However, when the truth came out, instead of being shunned, Felix's creativity was celebrated. The animals learned that true worth comes from within, and Felix became the most admired fox in the forest.
